intro: Ardisia serrulata var. chrysophylla, commonly known as the golden-leaf ardisia, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that display a striking golden-yellow coloration, especially in the sunlight. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for shaded garden landscapes.
